headline: Charter Closes $3.0 Billion Senior Unsecured Notes
summary: Charter Communications, Inc. (NASDAQ: CHTR) (along with its subsidiaries, "Charter") today announced that its subsidiaries, CCO Holdings, LLC ("CCO Holdings") and CCO Holdings Capital Corp. ("CCO Holdings Capital," and together with CCO Holdings, the "Issuers"), have closed on $3.0 billion in aggregate principal amount of senior unsecured notes consisting of the following securities:

headline: How Investors Are Reacting To Charter Communications (CHTR) $3 Billion High-Coupon Bond Issuance
summary: In early January 2026, Charter Communications completed US$3.00 billion of senior unsecured fixed-rate notes offerings, issuing 7.375% notes due 2036 and 7.00% notes due 2033 at par under Regulation S and Rule 144A. These higher-coupon, unsecured bonds highlight how Charter is refinancing or adding debt against a backdrop of industry competition, subscriber pressure, and cautious investor sentiment around its cable and broadband exposure. Next, we’ll examine how Charter’s sizeable,...
